document.docAuthor: Barbosa, Diego N. & Azevedo, Celso O.
document.docTitle: Anisepyris gilgaladi Barbosa & Azevedo 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Anisepyris Kieffer (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae), with description of 135 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Anisepyris Kieffer (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae), with description of 135 new species

heading.emphasis:
Anisepyris gilgaladi Barbosa & Azevedo
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description, male. Body length 6 mm . Head with green reflection; mesosoma with darkish green reflection and metapectal-propodeal disc black; wings sub-hyaline; metasoma dark castaneous. Head wide. Flagellomeres short, with dense and short setae. Mandible wide, curved, and with teeth equally wide. Median clypeal lobe angulate, long. Frons coriaceous . Antennal scrobe carinate. Eye large. Frontal angle of ocellar triangle acute; ocelli large. Vertex convex. Pronotal disc as long as wide, sparsely punctate; transverse pronotal carina present, incomplete; with posterior pronotal sulcus. Notaulus very narrow. Mesoscutellar sulcus narrow. Metapectal-propodeal disc short; metapostnotal median carina complete; longitudinal ridges present; metapostnotal-propodeal suture straight; paraspiracular carina present and inconspicuous; metapleural carina present and conspicuous; metapectalpropodeal disc with short striae; propodeal declivity strigate. Mesopleuron with anterior fovea closed; mesopleural fovea closed; lower fovea opened; posterior fovea absent; mesopleural suture opened. Forewing with stigma developed; Rs&M vein distinguished. Mesotibia not spinose. Claws trifid. Metasomal segments sparsely setose. Genitalia. Basiparamere shorter than paramere; paramere slender, rounded, with ventral and dorsal margin straight, sparsely setose; basivolsella straight; cuspis with arms short, dorsal arm wide; aedeagus with basal portion convex and slender, and apical portion as long as basal and slender; apodeme slender.

Distribution. Brazil : Goiás , Bahia , Espírito Santo , Minas Gerais , Rio de Janeiro , São Paulo ,
Rio Grande do Sul
.

Remarks. This new species differs from
A. strictus
by having the mandible wide with its teeth equally wide; the flagellomeres with dense setae; the transverse pronotal carina present and incomplete; the mesopleuron with the mesopleural suture not defined; the genitalia with the basiparamere not excavate; the paramere very long and clubshaped; the basivolsella straight; and the dorsal cuspis arm wide, whereas
A. strictus
has the mandible narrow with the lower tooth longer than the others; the flagellomeres with sparse setae; the transverse pronotal carina present and complete; the mesopleuron with the mesopleural suture defined; the genitalia with the basiparamere excavate; the paramere slender, rounded, and sinuous; the basivolsella with the inner margin angled; and the dorsal cuspis arm slender.
